item.title: Resume - David Allen
item.author: hbddallen@gmail.com (David Allen)
item.description: For my standard resume, click here to view it. Putting enough detail about my projects on a single page was hard, so if you’d like more details then I’d encourage you to look through this section! There’s four sections detailing more of each of my projects: Amateur Liquid Fueled Rocket Engine Breadboard Processor Fireworks Shell Taping Machine Custom Video Game Engine(s) Amateur Liquid Fueled Rocket Engine, Personal Project A long-term side project I’ve had to build a working liquid bipropellant rocket engine, with the biggest goal being to learn as much as possible.
item.dc:creator: David Allen

item.title: Igniter Prototype
item.author: hbddallen@gmail.com (David Allen)
item.description: Time I finally posted something :D I haven’t gotten as much done as I’d hoped, but I have managed to hack together design a prototype igniter to test out some systems and get a feel for everything. I figure I’d start with the igniter as it would be the simplest (and safest) system to prototype, and there’s actually flames involved! Reasoning So why did I choose to do the igniter first?
item.dc:creator: David Allen

item.title: Uh oh, I think I'm starting a blog
item.author: hbddallen@gmail.com (David Allen)
item.description: For better or for worse, I’ve decided to start a blog. I like doing just about anything technical that doesn’t involve biology (I still have the battle scars from freshman biology), and this blog should give me a chance to spread my ramblings. It might end up being pretty random, but hey, normal is boring right? My current main project is to create a liquid fueled rocket engine. Did I mention I’m nuts?
item.dc:creator: David Allen
